what: Deciding on Your Schedule for JSM
title: Deciding on Your Schedule for JSM
text: jsm2023 R package JSM talks. makes personalized recommendations talks (based citation network data) exports schedule ical file can loaded Google Calendar similar.

title: Deciding on Your Schedule for JSM
text: install package: example sort thing can package: produces data frame talks: See ?get_talks ways can filter talks. Finally, can export ical format, can imported Google Calendar standard calendars: imported Google Calendar, get following:
code: remotes::install_github("jacobbien/jsm2023-project", subdir = "jsm2023") # which of my co-authors are at JSM? my_coauthors <- jsm2023::get_coauthors("Jacob Bien")  # which of the people I cite the most are at JSM? people_cited_by_me <- jsm2023::get_out_citations("Jacob Bien")  # which of the people who cite me the most are at JSM? people_citing_me <- jsm2023::get_in_citations("Jacob Bien")  # when are their talks? schedule <- jsm2023::get_talks(   speakers = c(my_coauthors, people_cited_by_me[1:8], people_citing_me[1:8]),   session_types = "Paper",   days = c("2023-08-08", "2023-08-09", "2023-08-10") ) dplyr::select(schedule, speaker, title) #> # A tibble: 9 × 2 #>   speaker           title                                                        #>   <chr>             <glue>                                                       #> 1 Adel Javanmard    Precise Statistical Analysis of Classification Accuracies f… #> 2 Shuangge Ma       Replicability in cancer omics data analysis: measures and e… #> 3 Ali Shojaie       Consistent Causal Discovery via Mixed Integer Programming    #> 4 Daniela Witten    A new century of statistical inference                       #> 5 Ryan Tibshirani   How many parameters does your interpolator use? Revisiting … #> 6 Luo Xiao          Latent Factor Model for Multivariate Functional Data         #> 7 Lucy Gao          Inference after latent variable estimation for single-cell … #> 8 Alexandre Belloni Neighborhood Adaptive Estimators for Causal Inference under… #> 9 Arkajyoti Saha    Embarrassingly parallel large-scale spatial analysis with N… jsm2023::export_calendar_to_ics(schedule, file = "jsm-talks.ics")

title: Deciding on Your Schedule for JSM
text: scraped JSM 2023 program wrangled decades citation coauthorship data Semantic Scholar arxiv. also included functionality exporting schedule ical can loaded Google Calendar similar. result package streamlines process finding talks may want attend. first version done web app JSM 2019 Ronak Upadhyaya second version, JSM 2022, done Yibin Xiong. jsm2023 written using literate programming. particular, entire package generated “litr-knitting” single Rmd file. learn litr package literate programming approach writing R packages, see .

title: Get talks based on some criteria — get_talks
code: get_talks(speakers, authors, people, keywords, days, session_types)

title: Get talks based on some criteria — get_talks
text: speakers character vector speaker names.  Names start given (first) name, following format JSM program. authors character vector author names. . people character vector people names.  looks person speaker, author, organizer, chair. keywords character vector words look talk title days vector Dates (e.g. "2023-08-07") session_types character vector, e.g. "Invited Papers"
